> The diff coverage is `n/a`.

- Misses       4100     4235     +135

@WillAyd I get a `unexpectedly closed the connection` from codecov.io so i cant see the detailed report, but i'm not sure why you would approve this with a drop in code coverage in core modules other than panel. Am i missing something?

Didn’t look at the coverage report just code. Seemed to only pull out deprecated parts. 

Thanks for questioning though - is your concern that we are dropping tests for non-deprecated parts of code base?

Sent from my iPhone

> On Feb 8, 2019, at 11:42 AM, Simon Hawkins <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> @WillAyd I get a unexpectedly closed the connection from codecov.io so i cant see the detailed report, but i'm not sure why you would approve this with a drop in code coverage in core modules other than panel. Am i missing something?
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
my concern is that makePanel.to_fame is part of a least one test setup and the tested behaviour maybe non-panel related.

> my concern is that makePanel.to_fame is part of a least one test setup and the tested behaviour maybe non-panel related.

I'm guessing you're referring to the test in test_reshape.  There is another test where I manually reconstructed the equivalent of `tm.makePanel().to_frame()`.  We could put that code into `tm` and re-use it in the reshape test.  Would that handle your concern?

considering how difficult it can sometimes be to get a single line of code into the codebase, there is an incredible amount of value in the 1600+ lines of code being removed. being in the dark about the code coverage at the moment does make me concerned about a potential loss of value.

@simonjayhawkins we have *wanted* to remove this code for quite some time :-D

and removing codes IS much easier to approve than adding, reducing complexity is always a +1 from me (granted *removing* tests requires a fair amount of scrutiny).
